alert.note: Alert for Christian; Greene; Stone; Webster (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:16AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Webster, northern Christian, northeastern Stone and southeastern Greene Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 115 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Battlefield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield... Nixa... Ozark... Republic... Marshfield... Battlefield... Rogersville... Strafford... Clever... Seymour... Sparta... Highlandville... Fremont Hills... Fordland... Brookline... Diggins... Turners... Bruner... Selmore... Northview... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 69 and 71, and between mile markers 80 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
